attributes.additional_details:
Numerous jobs has been lost such as carpenter or salesperson. Student and families are being put into furlough (80%) or left to look for jobs when the majority of them are all unavailable. 
How does the government expect a student to pay the full tuition fees of £9250 for a degree that is being held online especially since it is obviously cheaper to run the classes online therefore, how are our current fees justified?
We are all demanding a refund or partial discount on our tuition fees!
attributes.background:
The Lockdowns restrictions has made it harder to seek a new job or  survive being put into furlough. Hours are being cut and taxes keep on increasing.
How can the government expect us to pay the full tuition fees of £9250 when there is no possible way to earn that money?

rejection.details:
You may like to sign some of the following petition which we currently have open on reducing student tuition:

Reduce University student tuition fees from £9250 to £3000
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550344

Lower university tuition fees for students until online teaching ends
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552911

Government subsidise this year's university tuition fees
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552814

Refund ALL University student tuition fees due to lack of quality in education
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555516
